title: Baxters logo w/ script-like serifs
content:
can anyone help with this

iam trying to identify the main Baxters font

any help is greatly appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/baxters_scan01_5213.jpg)
author: derm

comments.content:
I think this is custom lettering. The serifs are more script-like than serif font.

- Mike Yanega

Two serif faces with script-like serifs are [Underware](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Underware)’s Dolly and [Suitcase Type](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Suitcase%20Type)’s Dederon Serif. But they are quite different. I think that this is custom designed logo as well.

We usually like to offer some suggestions for alternatives, and here are three that might be similar in feeling, in addition to the ones Yves mentioned. I found these looking in the Sign Lettering section of the Script Font ID Guide:

[Geis](http://web.archive.org/web/20061111004730/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/galapagos/geis/) from Galapagos, by George Ryan

[Cyrano Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20061111004730/http:/www.unifonts.com/c_texhtm/cyranomodernregtex.htm) by Victor De Castro, Unifonts.

[Arjorie](http://web.archive.org/web/20061111004730/http:/www.unifonts.com/a_pages/arjoriemedium.htm), also by Victor De Castro, Unifonts.

In my opinion both these guys are artists, who put a lot of personality into their fonts.

- Mike Yanega
